summary: This bill, the "Ensuring Outpatient Quality for Rural States Act," aims to amend the Social Security Act to address the unique healthcare challenges faced by hospitals in Alaska and Hawaii. It proposes allowing the Secretary to adjust payments for hospital outpatient department (OPD) services in these states, specifically applying a cost-of-living adjustment to the non-labor related portion of payments. This is intended to improve access to and the quality of outpatient healthcare services in these rural states.
